title: ImageMagick GIF coder vulnerability leading to memory disclosure

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hello Hackerone Security Team,

Well,we are aware of Imagemagick Gif parsor method to collect the pixels and then we can recover it to gain server information.

https://github.com/neex/gifoeb

However,it has no impact on hackerone since it's immune to gif files uploading functionality.
So, ,gif exploit will not work at all using this method.

Today,I Bypassed that method and modified new files and well, server disclose the many information.

Hackerone profile picture uploading functionality supports .gif, .png, .bmp, ,.tiff and .tif.


Step to reproduce:-

1)Creating exploitable files

In the terminal, as we have to run
./gifoeb gen 512x512 dump.gif  in order to create exploitable dump.gif file where 512x512 is pixel dimension and dump.gif is an gif file.

In order to bypass, You can modify the commands like this
E.g

a)    ./gifoeb gen 1123x987 dump.jpg
b)    ./gifoeb gen 1123x987 dump.png
c)    ./gifoeb gen 1123x987 dump.bmp
d)   ./gifoeb gen 1123x987 dump.tiff
e)    ./gifoeb gen 1123x987 dump.tif

It will create the dump files with different extensions.
(Note: you can change the pixel dimension and file extension)

2) After creation of exploitable files, just upload in the profile settings. using modified Image files.

3) Server will return different pixel files.

4) Save and  recover the pixel files.

In my case, I uploaded dump files with different extensions and after recovery, server disclose the linux version As well as Server path directory.

This exploit was successful since whenever We upload the files,if we try to save an image, the webpage will automatically give .gif extension to save profile pictures.

Attaching with Screenshot and previews.rar 

With Regards
Kunal Pandey

## Impact

An attacker can collect Server info related to O/s and path directory and many more.
vulnerability_information_html:
Hello Hackerone Security Team,

Well,we are aware of Imagemagick Gif parsor method to collect the pixels and then we can recover it to gain server information.

https://github.com/neex/gifoeb

However,it has no impact on hackerone since it's immune to gif files uploading functionality.
So, ,gif exploit will not work at all using this method.

Today,I Bypassed that method and modified new files and well, server disclose the many information.

Hackerone profile picture uploading functionality supports .gif, .png, .bmp, ,.tiff and .tif.

Step to reproduce:-

1)Creating exploitable files

In the terminal, as we have to run
./gifoeb gen 512x512 dump.gif in order to create exploitable dump.gif file where 512x512 is pixel dimension and dump.gif is an gif file.

In order to bypass, You can modify the commands like this
E.g

a) ./gifoeb gen 1123x987 dump.jpg
b) ./gifoeb gen 1123x987 dump.png
c) ./gifoeb gen 1123x987 dump.bmp
d) ./gifoeb gen 1123x987 dump.tiff
e) ./gifoeb gen 1123x987 dump.tif

It will create the dump files with different extensions.
(Note: you can change the pixel dimension and file extension)

2) After creation of exploitable files, just upload in the profile settings. using modified Image files.

3) Server will return different pixel files.

4) Save and recover the pixel files.

In my case, I uploaded dump files with different extensions and after recovery, server disclose the linux version As well as Server path directory.

This exploit was successful since whenever We upload the files,if we try to save an image, the webpage will automatically give .gif extension to save profile pictures.

Attaching with Screenshot and previews.rar

With Regards
Kunal Pandey

Impact

An attacker can collect Server info related to O/s and path directory and many more.

activities.message:
Hi,

Thank you for your submission. We are investigating your report, and will let you know if we have any questions. We appreciate your assistance and cooperation.

Regards.
@joystick
activities.markdown_message:
Hi,

Thank you for your submission. We are investigating your report, and will let you know if we have any questions. We appreciate your assistance and cooperation.

Regards.
@joystick

activities.message: Thanks for letting us know, @kamaldeo337, we're looking into this.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks for letting us know, @kamaldeo337, we're looking into this.

activities.message: Hi @kamaldeo337 - to follow up here on our progress: we have temporarily disabled the processing GIF images. We're working on a more permanent fix, which we expect to release somewhere next week. Thanks for your patience!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @kamaldeo337 - to follow up here on our progress: we have temporarily disabled the processing GIF images. We're working on a more permanent fix, which we expect to release somewhere next week. Thanks for your patience!

activities.message: Thank you for the reply,you can disable .tiff,.bmp and .tif extension for uploading functionality,it will make more secure as this exploit has working upon this type of file extension too.
activities.markdown_message: Thank you for the reply,you can disable .tiff,.bmp and .tif extension for uploading functionality,it will make more secure as this exploit has working upon this type of file extension too.

additional_data.old_title: Uninitialized Sserver side memory disclosure bypass
additional_data.new_title: ImageMagick GIF coder vulnerability leading to memory disclosure

activities.message:
Hello Security Team,
Today, I again tested this type of vulnerability,but there is no reflected uninitialize pixel file at all.
I tried Different extensions ,but no result at all,so I believe this vulnerability is no more and has been eradicated completely.
So,this temporary fix is Totally immune to this attack,but we can't upload normal gif files for now.
So, I am anxiously waiting for permanent fix so that I can upload normal gif files as well.

Just a feedback from my side and I am very much thankful for your quick response and processing.

Thanks 
Kunal
activities.markdown_message:
Hello Security Team,
Today, I again tested this type of vulnerability,but there is no reflected uninitialize pixel file at all.
I tried Different extensions ,but no result at all,so I believe this vulnerability is no more and has been eradicated completely.
So,this temporary fix is Totally immune to this attack,but we can't upload normal gif files for now.
So, I am anxiously waiting for permanent fix so that I can upload normal gif files as well.

Just a feedback from my side and I am very much thankful for your quick response and processing.

Thanks
Kunal

activities.message: Hi @kamaldeo337 - thanks for retesting. There's still a couple things that we've planned to roll out over the next couple days. We've looked into this and the leaked memory seems to come from the heap over the ImageMagick process itself. Since we only convert profile pictures and profile headers, it doesn't contain any sensitive information since everyone can upload any picture. However, we still appreciate that you pointed out this flaw and would like to award you with a $500 bounty. We'll keep posting updates as we deploy some of our changes. We expect to being able to resolve this within the next two weeks. Thanks again!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @kamaldeo337 - thanks for retesting. There's still a couple things that we've planned to roll out over the next couple days. We've looked into this and the leaked memory seems to come from the heap over the ImageMagick process itself. Since we only convert profile pictures and profile headers, it doesn't contain any sensitive information since everyone can upload any picture. However, we still appreciate that you pointed out this flaw and would like to award you with a $500 bounty. We'll keep posting updates as we deploy some of our changes. We expect to being able to resolve this within the next two weeks. Thanks again!

activities.message:
Hey @kunal94,

Sorry for the long wait, we fixed the issue but the infra team is verifying if the fix worked for all of our machines. 

Thanks for you patience!

Willian
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @kunal94,

Sorry for the long wait, we fixed the issue but the infra team is verifying if the fix worked for all of our machines.

Willian

activities.message: Thanks for the update @wvdv, let's wait for verification and permanent fix. :)
activities.markdown_message: Thanks for the update @wvdv, let's wait for verification and permanent fix. :)

activities.message: Hi @kunal94 - thanks again for bringing this to our attention and your patience. We have implemented the remaining fixes. With the way we were using ImageMagick this couldn't have leaked any confidential information. However, this might've become a problem in the future and also made us realize that we missed a couple important updates in the past few months. Thanks again, much appreciated. We look forward to hear more from you in the future. Happy hacking!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @kunal94 - thanks again for bringing this to our attention and your patience. We have implemented the remaining fixes. With the way we were using ImageMagick this couldn't have leaked any confidential information. However, this might've become a problem in the future and also made us realize that we missed a couple important updates in the past few months. Thanks again, much appreciated. We look forward to hear more from you in the future. Happy hacking!

Kunal
